document.title: Business & Administrative Services, Logistics & Supply Chain Management, Finance and Marketing Career Field Pathways Business Foundations

2B38DD3FADFB4B7A90F17D1FA5EA5781.description:
Describe the purpose and information reported on the Income Statement, Statement
of Stockholders' Equity, Balance Sheet & Statement of Cash Flows.

6FEB9868004C472A98EE9509A2E7C90F.description:
Identify the regulatory bodies that set standards for business reporting (e.g.,
Financial Accounting Standards Board [FASB], Securities and Exchange
Commission [SEC], Public Company Accounting Oversight Board [PCAOB],
International Financial Reporting Standards [IFRS], Small- and Medium-Sized
Entities [SME] Financial Reporting Framework, Governmental Accounting Standards
Board [GASB]).

7B82A069FAAF4458BA0290649AF45D66.description:
Explain the importance of accurately reporting a business’s financial position and
activities, the types of systems that are used for that purpose (i.e., tax systems,
financial, cost systems) and the linkage to operational systems (i.e., enterprise
systems).

D848FDB6E4FF4C609DC13E66E1379FAD.description:
Financial Reporting and Auditing: Collect and analyze financial information and report financial activity in compliance with
applicable regulations, policies and processes.

E2B9EF75306E4075B3E2F63BD0123500.description:
Identify the components of the accounting equation and identify how business
transactions impact the equation and financial statements.

4D29EFE39D8A4C80839A8EB9ED2D6D3C.description:
Explain the accounting concepts that form the basis for accounting systems that
comply with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) (e.g., accounting
cycle, accounting method, accounting equation).

AF44D40DE0B74C978F88B2680FBBFB89.description: Financial Accounting: Apply principles of accounting to record and summarize financial transactions.

5827EA74C186493BADECCAEE310ACF5D.description:
Describe how financial needs differ in the stages of a business lifecycle (e.g.,
start-up, growth, maturity, decline).

DA01A55427F940C99B2C3D9C17E47B29.description:
Explain capital markets and corporate valuation models (e.g., stocks and bonds)
used in finance.

70A5EE99AA934559A69CE001CD4DFB7A.description: Corporate Investments: Identify policies, processes and strategies for making investments.

B4ABD20CCE1E47B38D9C40DFC81F2E3E.description: Identify traditional and non-traditional financing options.

C79C29499B8647BB89A2C928C546E889.description: Explain how accounting standards impact business financial performance.

ED821AB93F334D1D9C18C61254E32C69.description:
Explain the role and function of profit and taxes and how they differ depending on
business structure.

7D8189A5CCC341EE92027C0B74EF39A6.description:
Financial Principles: Identify and apply principles of finance and accounting to plan and monitor the use of financial
resources.

498A763183F84628B7C8CFBB3CA96AC3.description:
Financial Analysis and Evaluation: Learners apply principles of financial and managerial accounting to collect, analyze and
distribute financial data, evaluate investment opportunities and operate financial services.

F585F4FFF28C46E0B702A681AF056525.description: Analyze the effects of inputs and outputs on productivity levels.

9CD3CD0DCCD64C5F95801BDAEFB8DA8E.description: Discuss the relationship between economic output and a society’s standard of living.

C2559C9F4C9044A6A5FCD877A498E800.description: Supply Chain Management: Plan, implement and evaluate supply chain management activities.

5C79129F77BB404991E7B1915F9DA731.description: Operations Management: Learners identify and apply policies, processes and strategies for business operations.

46D5FC2125DC49918BBCF5705512B8BC.description: Describe how cultural difference impact management practices.

7077105CC588407293C56EE756F65A35.description:
Explain the role of management functions (e.g., planning, organizing, staffing,
leading, controlling), and how they impact business activities.

99B24345B4F24DB1935EAF19FA26159D.description: Describe the types of resources managed in business operations.

6A3321332A7F414B97395624BDBFA0C7.description:
Distinguish between management and leadership and describe the characteristics of
each.

3F105E7687154F178BC3E8F689ADF96C.description: Management Fundamentals: Identify business management functions and strategies.

5FA327F8E60241B8AA66088AD9A06BF6.description:
Business Management: Learners identify and apply policies, processes and strategies for effective management of
information, projects, strategy and talent.

D557A1C72CB94C3F983F19BF276DECB0.description: Identify the role, function and components of a business plan.

6D63233FD8724990A16622360B46804B.description:
Identify the initial steps to establish a business (e.g., select business structure,
complete legal and regulatory filings, establish financial and tax accounts).

379572AA43DC4FF79B8E72C6FCBB0E4A.description: Product and Services Development: Develop new products and services for commercialization.

8CBC05CE74B84DD5BDF1E1415983F5FB.description: Describe the role and function of market planning.

5544A659E9E84EE483B2BD1E83379BAC.description: Identify legal and ethical issues associated with marketing.

1DEFD1B5445E45088AF791093FD221CA.description: Identify the components of the marketing mix (e.g., product, price, promotion, place).

10C5BC0D5B384C06BFD58063824BA42B.description: Marketing Fundamentals: Identify principles of marketing and marketing functions.

CE5607580AFA4606BAFC2C5944065BB6.description:
Marketing: Learners create, communicate and evaluate business offerings by applying marketing
functions.

2D1C8A8921E3469691BC648C16C678A1.description:
Identify requirements needed for an enforceable contract, and differentiate among
types of contracts (e.g., oral, written, implied, transferable, nontransferable).

60303893D6D54EE99E6F92C90B25F16A.description:
Describe legal issues affecting businesses and the impact of government regulations
and regulatory agencies on businesses.

45DB1CCB9D50400B84CC0A272A251410.description:
Describe the role of the state and U.S. constitutions in business law, sources of law
in the United States and the role of the U.S. judicial system.

81A461B3E0CE4D64BB2DE0D6D664E6DE.description: Legal Foundations: Apply legal principles and regulatory policies to business activities.

48B1481C2BDF46DC9A415C60E22D019B.description:
Describe the rights and responsibilities of the employer and employee in
an employment contract or employment relationship.

9A3BF818878A4000950F80D075D44EE7.description:
Describe the purpose of employment laws and workplace regulations (e.g., OSHA,
ADA, FMLA, NLRA, Title VII, OFCCP, Minor Labor Laws, FLSA and related state
laws).

F47F706C6F7141BA9D4D0D7B0C031DF6.description:
Explain businesses’ responsibility for product safety and identify product liability
issues and the applicable laws and regulations.

17947DBCE2264E28B9BA8FCFB4D05AE5.description:
Describe consumer rights and responsibilities, services provided by consumer
protection agencies and consumer protection laws.

EB2FC6D229B4459DAAC5E98E02AA73E3.description: Legal Environment: Identify legal processes and requirements that impact business operations.

EEC0B82033D44A649CAA3304FABEB435.description:
Describe and compare types of business risks (e.g., strategic, operational, financial,
compliance, reputational).

F4FCA79BB3884F80806F1FBF25E9B5B1.description:
Describe the impact of government regulations and regulatory agencies on the
structure, focus and cost of enterprise risk management.

809869B780554A2490DB36C769D65AEA.description:
Explain the role of enterprise risk management in protecting and creating value for
stakeholders.

B4D1E17AD27D40708B69D80FBA931559.description: Risk Management Fundamentals: Identify policies, processes and strategies to manage risk.

B0309065C3C44D22A01898D422AECFA5.description:
Business Governance: Learners acquire foundational legal knowledge and apply business governance principles to
minimize risk, maintain organizational compliance and establish and maintain organizational
structure.

74515DEC231F4D1CBDFB27245E95BA0D.description: Compare and contrast the use of social media for personal and business purposes.

6EFF27BCF30A4AA9960E37A6A3E95510.description: Describe how personal social media use can impact the business.

69DD8D1F8D564F158BB9B48450EA4D46.description: Social Media Communications: Plan, create and evaluate social media communications.

6CCD66B9603E4ED9BE0A2113E28F7114.description:
Explain the role and function of indirect marketing strategies (e.g., social media,
search engine optimization [SEO], referral and loyalty rewards, online reviews, video
and image content, crowdsourcing).

FC895E17E1FD44B2B90C84C4AF36213F.description:
Explain the role and function of direct marketing strategies (e.g., direct mail, email,
phone calls, texting).

AE8D20F680A34E65A162EE5FA0DED226.description: Explain the types of media used in advertising.

F1E298FEA04E4B979FF689EC21A1B0D4.description: Marketing Communications: Communicate information about products, services, images or ideas.

1A7CC7A81D1C4F1D98CC8A45CCAFF212.description:
Identify strategies to promote diversity, equity and inclusion in business
communications.

C8A4E994D31D4C4A94EA05375B959072.description:
Explain how the content of communications creates reputational, legal and regulatory
exposure for organizations; and describe how to manage the risk individually and
collectively.

55980A5542E14F9A861547A45A5C0899.description: Business Communications Management: Plan, create and evaluate internal and external business communications.

DFB846720BA14B789723F0C21310B770.description:
Explain the role and function of customer relationship management and its impact on
business processes.

D4EB3AB772F94970B64F8C11DB191E6C.description:
Describe the importance of maintaining confidentiality and security of customer
information.

AA81069D849A4F84B3C1AE1E25F28C0F.description: Describe how the use of technology can impact customer relationships.

A4FBB4ED3B1C4C0C8C404BB90D447B2B.description: Describe the importance of meeting and exceeding customer expectations.

5F52DCF9209A47CEB157F433CF5631A7.description: Customer Relations: Develop, maintain and grow positive internal and external customer relationships.

9812DFC4D8F5434B9381E122FC101E3D.description:
Business Communications: Learners communicate with internal and external stakeholders by applying relationship
management techniques and business communication processes and strategies.

F760556B02C14CD28CF25E98FEAD6238.description: Explain the role and function of business processes and their interrelationships.

2A877D26658547BC9676B36AD041F4A4.description: Explain the impact of organizational structure on business processes.

ECEAD4AD11F64693AFC92151379648CF.description: Business Processes: Relate business processes to business models, operations and strategies.

42D23019B15E482B9640897AD3661053.description:
Analyze U.S. competitiveness at a global level for different industries and describe
factors impacting competitiveness.

21032D38BDC94C3CA7AF01AEA190D5C3.description:
Describe regulatory policies and the government agencies that influence global trade
and describe their impact.

9276CF131500448A9791E78F0B397A19.description: Describe product standards’ issues associated with global trade.

E2049A47E0AD42EBAABD449E96EEAA39.description:
Identify examples of emerging economies and describe their potential impact on
business activities.

7A20D2A968A3492EBB23B453D9681D2C.description:
Describe the impact of digital communication tools (e.g., Internet, video- and
computer conferencing, webcasts, email, social media, digital communications) on
global business activities.

B347277E5F9247748479170B23D7F160.description:
Explain the impact of a country's economic development on global trade (e.g., type of
economic system, natural resources, educational level, types of industries,
infrastructure, technology availability or adoption).

F78BC428F5DD4389B0949723D3CE0377.description:
Explain the impact of a country's geography, cultural history and social-political
environments on global trade.

E1A26ACC30CD45B083C6D60CF1ECE54C.description:
Describe the global environment in which businesses operate, identify leading
economies.

6C7681D0EE1C431487D1904D96D256EE.description: Global Business: Relate global business functions to internal business operations, activities and strategies.

05EF962FF9614F7395AB4DC6B1531656.description:
Compare and contrast the phases of business cycles (i.e., expansion, peak,
contraction, trough).

DCAC23293B914274ACA187D2C118A1F6.description:
Explain the role of the Federal Reserve System and how its policies regulate the
economy.

A2F6B11C0FE44C41BA0D2F5AA080715B.description:
Describe the types of market structures (e.g., perfect competition, monopolistic,
oligopoly, monopoly).

38D2EF644E80454E85753DA2E3C41D62.description:
Explain the concept of productivity, how it is measured and its importance to
business.

36992B9125C64B7D903074BF0AD1ABDA.description: Describe the different type of taxes paid by businesses.

2E74B2E6564D451DA058621451FD80E6.description:
Determine the relationship between government and business, identify government
agencies that facilitate trade, and describe the impact of government regulations on
business activities.

52C9C507B9694F96A34DF147F4F2BF56.description:
Distinguish between gross and net profit, identify factors affecting a business’s profit
(e.g., demand, chance, pricing, expenses, costs, the economy), and identify
controllable and non-controllable expenses.

A427821DC9D94CCE80DD3E24F9A79BB2.description: Identify the impact of small business and entrepreneurship on market economies.

BBB042227741407BA2B73FF5621E4AE1.description:
Explain the types of economic systems (e.g., traditional, command, market, and
mixed) and their advantages and disadvantages.

9E6E3FADFE204B68910186B66FA41B45.description: Explain types of economic resources and competition.

E807AE63322B456997847AD6526B9B34.description:
Describe the concepts of economic goods and services, economics and economic
activities (i.e., production, distribution, exchange, consumption and circular flow of
income model).

FFCF0F5600AB4296965F3E42944FEF56.description: Economic Principles: Relate principles of applied economics to business models, operations and strategies.

B559795BC5D6448498ACE99A5C9250B4.description:
Explain how businesses are adapting to the current environment (i.e., business
agility).

2C36184F165A4FB7948C9C6F8D0594B1.description:
Compare the differences in implementation of business activities that occur in big
versus small business.

783387E863B54418A7C1E391452DED15.description: Evaluate the impact of technology on business activities.

87949D951E3444D6815A7E818EA26D71.description:
Describe connections among business ethics, actions and results (e.g., influencing
consumer behavior, gaining market share).

52DD98E43B1F4150A1EA840D3C4A33C9.description:
Explain the role and function of logistics and how it interacts with other business
activities.

CB312804355A4278B04398EE1382D31D.description:
Explain the role and function of operations management and how it interacts with
other business activities.

29C71EB1543943D19865F6513D8A74F3.description:
Explain the role and function of supply chain management and how it interacts with
other business activities.

8B8EC98B009448A781CE9E5D3245B371.description:
Explain the role and function of marketing and how it interacts with other business
activities.

FC8ED0EADF3F467EBCCAA4959E607649.description:
Explain the role and function of information management and how it interacts with
other business activities.

9D8752F442014C3EA6F15B14DFEC22C3.description:
Explain the role and function of human resources management and how it interacts
with other business activities.

24A10C56C8E6400BA8A3B7DEC2BE823C.description:
Explain the role and function of accounting and finance and how they interact with
other business activities.

E3438827A5854357B4BFD4A64AD13ACF.description:
Explain forces driving business changes (e.g., globalization, consumer demand,
government policies, legal/regulatory changes, political climate, diversity, spending
trends, industry structure changes).

A9E61FF13D8B4CB5BE7E45D4230CCD28.description: Explain why businesses exist and the role of business in society.

41C64E8F1E3648899354E0A957B607E5.description: Business Activities: Relate business functions to business models, operations and strategies.

4AB2AEE488B14C39B724597BA9532965.description:
Business Foundations: Learners acquire foundational knowledge of business activities supported by economic
principles, business processes and global business considerations.

BAF61476500743738702D700BCD936DD.description:
Review and summarize categories (types) of insurance and identify how insurances
can reduce financial risk.

2F8D2279B77F4AEBAB5D930513CF2DDB.description:
Explain how credit ratings and the criteria lenders use to evaluate repayment
capacity affect access to loans.

59395C2B7C584233A703392007EF591B.description:
Review and summarize savings, investment strategies and purchasing options (e.g.,
cash, lease, finance, stocks, bonds).

FF0B64505EB84E52BEC4AA25989B9B39.description:
Create, analyze, and interpret financial documents (e.g., budgets, income
statements).

8CB5DDBA71814A978D2593DC6BBE69ED.description:
Financial Management: Use financial tools, strategies and systems to develop, monitor, and control the use of financial
resources to ensure personal and business financial well-being.

0BD9A73532624843B332A1FAC6B07AD9.description:
Select and use software applications to locate, record, analyze and present
information (e.g., word processing, e-mail, spreadsheet, databases, presentation,
Internet search engines).

9CF2C285AA83475986E5B03342E15F78.description:
Knowledge Management and Information Technology: Demonstrate current and emerging strategies and technologies used to collect, analyze,
record and share information in business operations.

138C953668F54AC1BF39A484BD67B43E.description:
Use interpersonal skills to provide group leadership, promote collaboration, and work
in a team.

BC39EB266AE443C58A0C2E2552728DBE.description: Use proper grammar and expression in all aspects of communication.

0E443CFA50B7480DBCD1E4A743C7873E.description:
Communicate information (e.g., directions, ideas, vision, workplace expectations) for
an intended audience and purpose.

AE06144ECF8243DC84E813994009D12B.description:
Identify and use verbal, nonverbal, and active listening skills to communicate
effectively.

9571DBBF9B1140EFB851AF27C0BD9811.description:
Leadership and Communications: Process, maintain, evaluate and disseminate information in a business. Develop leadership
and team building to promote collaboration.

BC517B5D4B594AC4B912053F555C07A5.description:
Explain the importance of work ethic, accountability, and responsibility and
demonstrate associated behaviors in fulfilling personal, community and workplace
roles.

9ED997EA527747DEB09EE53300DFC6EB.description:
Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and secondary and
postsecondary options.

7F60377D7D8045D3A7FD040EE6766050.description:
Identify the scope of career opportunities and the requirements for education,
training, certification, licensure and experience.

D17F7C50BF29499A8604DFDD4024556A.description: Identify the knowledge, skills and abilities necessary to succeed in careers.

44FA201028C1464582A60F9311C95E2C.description:
Employability Skills: Develop career awareness and employability skills (e.g., face‐to‐face, online) needed for
gaining and maintaining employment in diverse business settings.

C3F1157F9AD843B5A8989D130E5D8EED.description:
Business Operations/21st Century Skills: Learners apply principles of economics, business management, marketing and employability
in an entrepreneur, manager and employee role to the leadership, planning, developing and
analyzing of business enterprises related to the career field.
